bibl.title: The Tazza Farnese: Augusto Imperatore "Redeunt Saturnia Regna!"
bibl.note: The Tazza Farnese was made between 30 and 10 B.C. by an Alexandrian artist working in the West for the emperor Augustus. The chief figures are Saturnus and Gallus (or Genius Galliarum) and the composition celebrates the new Golden Age founded by Augustus after his victory at Actium.
bibl.seg: POLLINI John, The Tazza Farnese: Augusto Imperatore "Redeunt Saturnia Regna!"

The Tazza Farnese was made between 30 and 10 B.C. by an Alexandrian artist working in the West for the emperor Augustus. The chief figures are Saturnus and Gallus (or Genius Galliarum) and the composition celebrates the new Golden Age founded by Augustus after his victory at Actium.
